channel.title: India news from ESPN Cricinfo.com
channel.description: Visit Cricinfo.com for up-to-the-minute cricket news, breaking cricket news, live cricket commentary, ball-by-ball commentary, cricket video, cricket audio and features.

item.title: Tilak Varma to miss New Zealand T20Is, will join India T20 World Cup squad on February 3
item.description: The 23-year-old batter is on his way back from testicular surgery

item.title: Harmanpreet and Rohit to receive Padma Shri Award in 2026
item.description: The Indian government announced a list of 131 awardees on Sunday, which included the two World Cup-winning captains

item.title: Former BCCI president IS Bindra dies aged 84
item.description: He also served as the president of the Punjab Cricket Association from 1978 to 2014

item.title: Abhishek slams India's second-fastest T20I half-century
item.description: He remains behind his mentor Yuvraj Singh, who still holds the India record of a 12-ball fifty against England in 2007

item.title: Abhishek blasts 14-ball fifty to hand India unassailable 3-0 lead against NZ
item.description: It was India's second-fastest T20I fifty after Bumrah and Bishnoi restricted NZ to 153

item.title: India opt to bowl in third T20I against New Zealand, Bumrah back
item.description: New Zealand made only one change, with Kyle Jamieson coming in for Zak Foulkes

item.title: Upbeat India target series win against New Zealand in Guwahati
item.description: New Zealand have been blown away in the two games so far and will need a special show to stop the Indian juggernaut

item.title: India to face Pakistan in Under-19 World Cup Super Six stage
item.description: India will also face Zimbabwe while Pakistan's other opponents are New Zealand

item.title: Kishan and Suryakumar lay down marker in astonishing chase
item.description: From 6 for 2 in a chase of 209, India romped home with 28 balls to spare

item.title: Suryakumar on Kishan's counterattack: 'This is what we want from batters'
item.description: India's captain was full of praise for Kishan, who led India's revival from 6 for 2 with an audacious 32-ball 76

item.title: India bowl and rest Bumrah, Axar out injured
item.description: Harshit Rana and Kuldeep Yadav came into their side

item.title: Uttar Pradesh's Prashant Veer suffers shoulder injury
item.description: Veer is understood to have suffered a grade-2 tear that could keep him out of action for at least three weeks

item.title: Pressure on NZ as they look to stop India's T20 juggernaut
item.description: India will not want to let up any of the intensity as they stay in central India and move from Nagpur to Raipur

item.title: Bengal's Abhimanyu Easwaran run out after leaving crease to get drinks
item.description: The batter had assumed the ball was dead, and was run out for 81

item.title: Abhishek and Rinku fireworks help India start series in style
item.description: Glenn Phillips' 78 off 40 kept New Zealand's hopes going for a while before India struck regularly to seal victory

item.title: Abhishek: I back myself because I don't have a lot of shots
item.description: The India opener explained how he prepares for a T20 game and that he relies more on timing than power-hitting

item.title: Chinnaswamy remains in line to host RCB's home games during IPL 2026
item.description: The franchise, however, has mooted other contingencies including playing home games in Navi Mumbai and Raipur

item.title: New Zealand bowl and hand Kristian Clarke T20I debut
item.description: Kuldeep Yadav and Harshit Rana sat out for India, with Axar Patel carded at No. 8

item.title: Mitchell goes past Kohli to become top men's ODI batter in the world
item.description: Daryl Mitchell has opened up a large gap with second-placed Virat Kohli after scoring 352 runs, including two centuries, in the ODI series against India

item.title: T20 World Cup crisis: PCB writes to ICC supporting Bangladesh's stance
item.description: The ICC Board is expected to meet on Wednesday to take a final call on Bangladesh's participation at the T20 World Cup

item.title: सूर्यकुमार: विश्व कप को ध्यान में रखते हुए किशन नंबर तीन पर खेलेंगे
item.description: भारतीय कप्तान ने कहा कि विश्व कप की तैयारियों को देखते हुए किशन को अय्यर पर प्राथमिकता दी जाएगी

item.title: Can New Zealand finally crack India in T20I series?
item.description: New Zealand have a never won a T20I series against India in India, but will look to change history as full-strength sides meet ahead of the T20 World Cup

item.title: Kishan to bat at No. 3 keeping T20 World Cup in mind, Suryakumar says
item.description: Kishan is part of the squad for the tournament as back-up wicketkeeper, while Iyer, selected for the first three T20Is against NZ in Tilak's absence, is not

item.title: South Africa women to host India for five T20Is in April
item.description: This will be SA's final T20I assignment and India's penultimate one before the 2026 T20 World Cup in England

item.title: Arshdeep comes in as India ask New Zealand to bat in ODI series decider
item.description: India have left out Prasidh Krishna to accommodate Arshdeep Singh, while New Zealand have fielded an unchanged playing XI

item.title: Mitchell, Phillips centuries trump Kohli's as New Zealand win first-ever ODI series in India
item.description: Kohli and Rana's 99-run seventh-wicket stand threatened to spoil New Zealand's party

item.title: Rehan Ahmed and Adil Rashid issued visas to travel to India for T20 World Cup
item.description: The ICC is confident that Indian visas for all players, support staff and officials of Pakistani origin or nationals at the event will be arranged in time

item.title: Bangladesh vs India: No handshakes at toss, but players shake hands after game
item.description: BCB statement says the absence of a handshake at the toss was unintentional on their part

item.title: India and NZ have selection concerns for series decider in high-scoring Indore
item.description: After a historic Test series win in India in 2024, New Zealand will aim for their maiden ODI series win in the country on Sunday

item.title: Shreyas Iyer, Ravi Bishnoi added to India squad for NZ T20Is
item.description: They have replaced the injured Tilak Varma and Washington Sundar

item.title: Washington ruled out of New Zealand T20Is as well
item.description: Washington is recovering from the side strain he suffered during the first ODI

item.title: Mitchell upstages Rahul as New Zealand level series
item.description: NZ ace chase of 285 to set up a series decider in high-scoring Indore

item.title: Kohli displaces Rohit to rise to No. 1 in men's ODI batting rankings
item.description: Travis Head, Mitchell Starc and Steven Smith rose in the Test rankings after Australia's 4-1 Ashes win

item.title: Reddy in for Washington; New Zealand ask India to bat in Rajkot
item.description: Shubman Gill said he would have batted first anyway and that there wasn't much dew at the venue when they trained the night before

item.title: India halt NZ's winning run and eye series spoils
item.description: Who will take the injured Washington Sundar's place? Nitish Reddy or Ayush Badoni?

item.title: No spectators for two WPL games due to elections in Navi Mumbai
item.description: The DC-UPW and MI-UPW fixtures are set to be played behind closed doors

item.title: Badoni replaces injured Washington in India squad for NZ ODIs
item.description: Washington has been sidelined with a rib injury and will be assessed by the BCCI medical team

item.title: India scrape home after Kohli, Gill hit half-centuries
item.description: New Zealand struck three times in 13 balls to dismiss, Kohli, Jadeja and Iyer to give India a brief scare in 301 chase

item.title: Kohli: 'Back myself to counterattack than just playing the situation'
item.description: Kohli's 93 set up India's victory in the first ODI against New Zealand despite late strikes from Jamieson

item.title: India bowl; Clarke makes international debut for New Zealand
item.description: Shreyas Iyer is back playing for India for the first time since he suffered an injury in October 2025

item.title: Pant ruled out of India's ODI series against New Zealand
item.description: Wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant has suffered a side strain with Dhruv Jurel replacing him

item.title: India stars face New Zealand upstarts in a series of divided priorities
item.description: Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma are back but they'll be facing a depleted opposition

item.title: Gill on India's scheduling: Ensure adequate preparation time before Test series
item.description: India had less than a week's time after white-ball assignments to prepare for their recent home Test series agaist West Indies and South Africa

item.title: UP Warriorz bowl against Gujarat Giants
item.description: Meg Lanning, Phoebe Litchfield, Deandra Dottin and Sophie Ecclestone made up UPW's overseas contingent

item.title: Shreyas Iyer cleared to join India squad for NZ ODIs
item.description: India batter will link up with the side on Friday, ahead of Sunday's ODI series opener against NZ in Vadodara

item.title: Vikram Rathour joins Sri Lanka as consultant batting coach till end of T20 World Cup
item.description: Vikram Rathour will join the squad on January 18, four days before the start of Sri Lanka's white-ball series at home against England

item.title: Tilak Varma ruled out of first three T20Is against New Zealand
item.description: His availability for the remaining two matches will be assessed based on his progress during the return-to-training and skill phases

item.title: ICC to Bangladesh: play in India or forfeit points
item.description: The BCB, though, has claimed no such ultimatum has been relayed to them by the governing body

item.title: Shreyas Iyer to captain Mumbai in remaining VHT league games
item.description: The India ODI vice-captain, who is returning to competitive cricket after recovering from a spleen injury, steps in for the injured Shardul Thakur

item.title: Bangladesh bans IPL broadcast over Mustafizur row
item.description: Bangladesh government adopts strong stance "in public interest" after KKR released Mustafizur Rahman from their IPL 2026 squad on instructions from the BCCI

item.title: Bangladesh refuse to travel to India for T20 World Cup
item.description: The BCB has cited concerns around "safety and well-being" of the players in a climate of deteriorating political ties between the two countries

item.title: Shreyas Iyer, Gill back in India's ODI squad for NZ series
item.description: Siraj also returns to the ODI set-up, having last played the format in October 2025 in Australia

item.title: Shreyas Iyer could return to action on January 6 in the Vijay Hazare Trophy
item.description: India's ODI squad for the New Zealand series will be picked on Saturday

item.title: Harmanpreet leads the way as India complete 5-0 sweep over SL
item.description: India were struggling at 77 for 5 before Harmanpreet's 43-ball 68 took India to a match-winning 175

item.title: ICC gives 'satisfactory' rating to Eden Gardens pitch for India-South Africa Test
item.description: Neither team had passed 200 even once in a three-day Test defined by uneven bounce and sharp turn

item.title: Shafali, Renuka close in on top five in ICC T20I rankings
item.description: Shafali has advanced four places among batters whereas Renuka went up eight spots on the bowlers' charts

item.title: Aman Khan concedes 123 runs, the most in a men's List A game
item.description: The previous record was held by Arunachal's Mibom Mosu, who had given away 116 earlier this month

item.title: India look to cap off successful year with clean sweep over Sri Lanka
item.description: Sri Lanka, meanwhile, would look to make India pay for their sloppy fielding before they sign off from the tour

item.title: Mandhana, Shafali and Ghosh help India edge run-fest to go 4-0 up
item.description: Both India and Sri Lanka posted their highest T20I scores after three one-sided low-scoring games

item.title: Mandhana becomes fourth woman to 10,000 international runs
item.description: She is the second Indian woman to the landmark after Mithali Raj, who leads the charts with 10,868 runs

item.title: Kohli breaks a Tendulkar record, Rohit catches up with Warner
item.description: Virat Kohli is now the fastest to 16,000 List A runs, while Rohit Sharma has the joint-highest number of 150-plus scores in the format

item.title: Match fees more than doubled for women's domestic cricketers in India
item.description: The changes are part of BCCI's ongoing efforts to elevate the domestic game in the wake of India's maiden ODI World Cup triumph

item.title: Shafali 69*, spinners lead India's rout of Sri Lanka
item.description: After Vaishnavi and Charani squeezed SL, Shafali made light work of the 129-run chase, scoring an unbeaten half-century

item.title: Deepti becomes No. 1 T20I bowler; Wolvaardt tops ODI batting charts
item.description: Jemimah Rodrigues jumped to No. 9 among T20I batters after match-winning 69 against SL

item.title: Sarfaraz to Pakistan's U-19s after beating India: 'Celebrate but with decorum'
item.description: In a video from the Asia Cup final that went viral, Pakistan's mentor was heard telling his players not to be uncivil even if India's players crossed lines

item.title: India dominant with bat and ball but fielding needs improvement
item.description: India dropped five catches in the series opener, including three straightforward ones

item.title: K Gowtham retires from all forms of cricket
item.description: Gowtham, 37, finishes with 394 wickets across formats for Karnataka in a domestic career that spanned for nearly 14 years

item.title: Rodrigues fifty leads India's chase after bowlers set up victory against Sri Lanka
item.description: Sri Lanka's 121 was a below-par total given dew was only going to increase as temperatures reduced

item.title: India and Sri Lanka eye solid build-up ahead of T20 World Cup next year
item.description: India return to T20Is after their maiden ODI World Cup title at home, while Sri Lanka play their first match in the format since March

item.title: Leaving Gill out: did India pivot for the right reasons?
item.description: Kishan bolted into the squad on domestic form, creating room for a middle-order batter

item.title: 'I know what to do' - Suryakumar vows to return to form ahead of T20 World Cup
item.description: India have only five T20Is ahead of the ICC event, with Suryakumar out of runs for over a year

item.title: Gill left out of India's T20 World Cup squad; Rinku, Kishan make comebacks
item.description: Jitesh Sharma also misses out; Axar Patel named vice-captain

item.title: Tilak, Hardik, Varun seal T20I series win for India
item.description: India took four wickets for 15 to scuttle the chase after a scare from de Kock and Brevis

item.title: Foot injury rules Shubman Gill out of the fifth T20I against South Africa
item.description: Samson replaced Gill while Bumrah and Washington came in for Kuldeep and Rana

item.title: Ahmedabad welcomes India, SA for final hurrah of epic tour
item.description: With the series still alive, SA need a win to share the T20I series honours

item.title: Kishan and Kushagra lead Jharkhand to SMAT glory
item.description: The pair muscled Jharkhand to 262, ensuring they clinched their maiden T20 trophy with ease

item.title: Fourth T20I abandoned due to foggy conditions in Lucknow
item.description: The series moves to its finale in Ahmedabad with India 2-1 up

item.title: Tilak Varma moves to No. 4 in T20Is; Chakravarthy solidifies top spot among bowlers
item.description: Abhishek Sharma retained the top batting spot despite scoring just 69 runs across three innings in the series against South Africa

item.title: Cameron Green becomes most expensive overseas player in IPL; uncapped Indians go big
item.description: Kolkata Knight Riders won a bidding war with Chennai Super Kings to buy the Australian allrounder

item.title: Uncapped Prashant Veer and Kartik Sharma smash IPL auction records
item.description: They became the joint-most-expensive uncapped Indian players ever signed at an IPL auction

item.title: Freedom is South Africa's biggest asset as India look to extend proud record
item.description: A win in Lucknow or Ahmedabad will take India's unbeaten streak in T20I series to 14

item.title: Abhigyan Kundu's unbeaten 125-ball 209 hands big win for India
item.description: In return, Malaysia could only muster 93, with medium pacer Deepesh Devendran running through the line-up to finish with a five-for

item.title: IPL 2026 to be held between March 26 and May 31
item.description: The IPL will kick off roughly three weeks after the T20 World Cup, and clash with the PSL

item.title: Axar ruled out of last two T20Is against South Africa; Shahbaz named replacement
item.description: Shahbaz last played for India at the 2023 Asian Games in Hangzhou

item.title: Arshdeep, Harshit set the tone in seam-friendly Dharamsala as India go 2-1 up
item.description: SA were bowled out for 117, but Abhishek Sharma's blazing knock ensured India won despite a wobble

item.title: Axar ill and Bumrah misses third T20I for personal reasons; South Africa make three changes
item.description: For the visitors, Tristan Stubbs, Corbin Bosch and Anrich Nortje came in for David Miller, Lutho Sipamla and George Linde

item.title: India under pressure as South Africa keep pushing them into corners
item.description: A potentially spicy final week of this exciting tour is now upon us

item.title: Vaibhav Suryavanshi slams 95-ball 171 in Under-19 Asia Cup opener
item.description: Vaibhav Suryavanshi's innings against UAE saw him fall just six runs short of the India record for highest score in a youth one-day match, held by Ambati Rayudu

item.title: Quinton de Kock's 90 powers SA to massive win
item.description: Chasing 214, India lost their last five wickets for just five runs and succumbed to a 51-run defeat

item.title: Harmanpreet Kaur, Yuvraj Singh stands inaugurated at New Chandigarh Stadium
item.description: The stands were inaugurated before the start of the second men's T20I between India and South Africa at the venue

item.title: Ticket sales announced for 2026 T20 World Cup
item.description: Prices in phase one of the ticket sales start at INR 100 and LKR 1000

item.title: 2026 T20 World Cup: Packed run-in for India, no games for Bangladesh
item.description: Here's how each Full Member team's run-in to the T20 World Cup looks

item.title: Kohli closes in on Rohit at the top of ODI batting rankings
item.description: Mitchell Starc's 18 wickets in the first two Ashes Tests have pushed him up to No. 3 among Test bowlers

item.title: Dinesh Karthik appointed London Spirit mentor and batting coach
item.description: "The signing of another elite individual with significant stature in the game demonstrates our ambition," London Spirit director of cricket Mo Bobat says

item.title: India look to press home the advantage against South Africa after opening bash
item.description: No men's internationals have taken place in New Chandigarh, but most of the India players have been here during IPL 2025

item.title: Hardik, Arshdeep crush South Africa to put India 1-0 up
item.description: South Africa were bowled out for 74, their lowest T20I score

item.title: Teenagers Kamalini and Vaishnavi receive maiden India call-ups for Sri Lanka T20Is
item.description: Radha Yadav, Yastika Bhatia and Sayali Satghare, who were part of the previous T20I squad that played against England, have been left out

item.title: Gill and Hardik return for India after South Africa opt to bowl
item.description: Both teams picked four seam options with Nortje returning for his first international game since last year's T20 World Cup final

item.title: Strong India face shaky South Africa in key build-up to T20 World Cup
item.description: India have a largely settled side, while this series may give us our first glimpse of the kind of XI SA hope to play in the 2026 tournament

item.title: Gill, Hardik 'healthy and fit' ahead of first India-South Africa T20I
item.description: Gill had suffered a neck injury during the first Test against SA, while Hardik had injured his left quadriceps during the Asia Cup
